subject: Re: [sugar] Sugar configuration file
body:
John Watlington wrote:
> I noticed a recent change in the behavior of the sugar configuration  
> file.
> In previous builds (say 385) I was able to delete /home/olpc/.sugar/ 
> default/config
> and upon reboot the laptop prompted me again for a nickname and color.
>
> With build 406, when I delete /home/olpc/.sugar/default/config, sugar  
> never starts
> up, instead X continually restarts.   Guess I shouldn't do that.
>
> What is the correct way to reset a laptop to an "out of box" state ?
> Deleting all files and directories except nm, logs, and session.info ?
>   

To reset to "out of box" you can just rm -rf ~/.sugar

Marco
